item.title: CASE Research Exhibited at Time Space Existence
item.description:
Friday, May 9, 2025 6:00 PM - Fri , October 31, 2025 7:00 PM -- Local timeSaturday, May 10, 2025 12:00 AM - Sat, November 1, 2025 12:00 AM -- Europe/Rome
Where: Palazzo Mora Strada Nova, 3659 Venezia VE, Italy 30121
Description: CASE is proud to feature research in Time Space Existence, a biennial exhibition hosted by ECC Italy running from May 2025 through November 2025.\nThe group exhibition invites international architects, designers, artists, academics, and researchers to engage with the pivotal theme of Repair, Regenerate, and Reuse. The show presents a dynamic array of works that offer innovative responses to some of the most urgent environmental, environmental, social, and cultural challenges of our time.
Contact: Kathie Brill 7187551688

item.title: Pittsburgh Building Closed for Renovations This Summer
item.description:
Monday, May 12, 2025 12:00 AM - Thu , August 21, 2025 12:00 AM
Where: Pittsburgh Bldg.
Description: The Pittsburgh Building will be fully closed for renovations beginning Monday, May 12, and will remain inaccessible through Wednesday, August 21. During this period, no access will be permitted for any faculty, staff, students, or visitors. Please plan accordingly. Thank you for your cooperation as we work to improve our facilities.
Contact: Victoria Luzinas 518-276-6590

item.title: TIAA Confidential Counseling (In-Person)
item.description:
Thursday, June 5, 2025 8:00 AM - 4:30 PM
Where: Human Resources-Gurley Building
Description: A TIAA Financial Consultant will be available for one-on-one consultations on a broad range of retirement topics. Attend this upcoming event to help you become better informed and more confident about Rensselaer's retirement plan benefits. Consultations will be conducted in 60 minute increments. To schedule your individual retirement counseling, please call TIAA at 1-800-732-8353 or online at https://shared.tiaa.org/public/publictools/events/meetingatworkplace
Contact: Human Resources 518-276-6302

item.title: Virtual Off Campus Housing Fair
item.description:
Thursday, June 5, 2025 9:00 AM - 10:30 AM
Where: Off-campus (see description)
Description: Several Property owners will be available to answer students’ questions regarding their rental options. Join the Discord Server and the event will start in the Housing Fair Channel.
Contact: Graham Knowles 518-276-6740

item.title: Coffee & Conversation
item.description:
Thursday, June 5, 2025 11:00 AM - 1:00 PM
Where: Mueller Center
Description: Students are invited to stop by for a cup of coffee, a little treat and an opportunity to socially connect with peers!
Contact: Mueller Center 518-276-2874

item.title: Computer Science Colloquia - Ben Greenman: Kicking the Ladder Away: From Gradual Types to Plain Types
item.description:
Thursday, June 5, 2025 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM
Where: Ricketts 211
Description: Ben Greenman is an assistant professor in the Kahlert School of Computing at the University of Utah. He earned his Ph.D. from Northeastern University in 2020 and was a CIFellows 2020 postdoc at Brown University. His team develops methods to measure performance, prove guarantees, and understand human factors for languages and systems.
Contact: Shannon Carrothers 518-276-8291

item.title: Rensselaer at Work Hosts Systems Engineering Information Session on June 6
item.description:
Friday, June 6, 2025 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM
Where: Online
Description: This 30-minute information session is hosted by Dean Aric Krause, Ph.D., and will focus on Rensselaer's Systems Engineering and Technology Management graduate degree. The degree is digitally delivered, flexible, and project-based to prepare decision-makers with broader and deeper capabilities in leading dynamic organizations. The session will highlight program details and how you can select graduate certificates relevant to your work to complete your graduate degree.
Contact: Alice A. Denny (860) 548-2403

item.title: Troy Compost seeks Volunteers
item.description:
Saturday, June 7, 2025 8:00 AM - 2:00 PM
Where: Campus-wide
Description: Troy Compost has been organizing a number of big composting initiatives in Troy, such as the Farmer's Market foodscraps collection, a project that diverts food waste from landfills to get composted at local farms instead. Volunteering with us is a 2-hour, low-intensity, educational gig that does good work for a community organization, local farms, and the Troy waste stream. You don't have to be an expert on compost to help out. Contact Guy Schaffer at schafe@rpi.edu for more information.
Contact: Green Greeks

item.title: Fall 2025 SIS registration closes for all continuing Undergraduate students
item.description:
Sunday, June 8, 2025 (all day)
Where: Campus-wide
Description: SIS registration closes for all continuing Undergraduate students

Where: Campus-wide

item.title: Division of Human Resources Professional Development Seminar: "Supervisory Essentials"
item.description:
Tuesday, June 10, 2025 8:30 AM - 4:30 PM
Where: Pat's Barn Rensselaer Technology Park
Cost: Free-Registration is Required
Description: In this seminar, Managers and Supervisors will learn from each other and our Facilitators about important topics such as the Employee Value Proposition and Employee Experience, the six fundamental Leadership competencies at Rensselaer, and experience several “Supervisory Simulations” with colleagues. In addition, the importance of coaching employee performance, providing both rewards and recognition, employment law fundamentals and tools for building team capacity will be explored.
Contact: Will Fahey 518-276-2318

item.title: Graduate Christian Fellowship Bible Study
item.description:
Tuesday, June 10, 2025 6:00 PM - 8:00 PM
Where: Library Conference Room
Description: Graduate Christian Fellowship is a group of graduate students who regularly meet for a meal and Bible study throughout the Fall and Spring semesters. We meet in the Library Conference Room from 6:00pm to 7:30pm every Tuesday. Anyone is welcome to come.
Contact: RPI Graduate Christian Fellowship

item.title: Mechanical Engineering Review with Rensselaer at Work
item.description:
Wednesday, June 11, 2025 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM
Where: Online
Description: Join Rensselaer at Work faculty on a 30-minute information session covering Rensselaer’s online, project-based Master of Engineering program in Mechanical Engineering. Experienced engineers are asked to take on larger and more complex tasks as they progress in their careers, and this program provides the necessary breadth and depth, no matter where one's career takes them. Learn how professionals can develop their practice in core mechanical disciplines while being able to customize their degree
Contact: Alice A. Denny (860) 548-2403

item.title: Full Moon Hike
item.description:
Wednesday, June 11, 2025 7:30 PM - 11:00 PM
Where: Rensselaer Union Horseshoe
Description: Join Outdoor Programs in a Full Moon Hike. Visit recwell.rpi.edu or reach out to weinew2@rpi.edu for more information.
Contact: Mueller Center 518-276-2874

item.title: Rensselaer at Work Information Session Scheduled For June 13
item.description:
Friday, June 13, 2025 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM
Where: Online
Description: Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph. D., will be reviewing the online, project-based graduate degrees and certificates. Expect to hear details about how RPI Instructor Mentors provide industry expertise, advice, and mentorship in a targeted and experiential learning environment. Please RSVP if you plan to attend and learn more about Rensselaer at Work.
Contact: Alice A. Denny (860) 548-2403

item.title: School of Science Arch Field Trip: American Museum of Natural History
item.description:
Saturday, June 14, 2025 6:00 AM - 7:30 PM
Where: New York, NY New York
Description: ALL MAJORS WELCOME! Students will be able to view all the ticketed exhibits, including “Encounters in the Milky Way” Space Show, “Invisible Worlds” Immersive Experience, the Butterfly Vivarium, “The Secret World of Elephants”, “World Beyond Earth” Giant-Screen Film and “Life at the Limits: Nature's Superheroes”. Breakfast and lunch will be provided. Meet at RPI Union horseshoe entrance at 6:00 AM, bus departure at 6:30 AM. Bus will return to RPI by 7:30 PM. Sign-up ends 4 PM June 13.
Contact: Kaylyn Getwright 5182766305

item.title: Troy Compost seeks Volunteers

Saturday, June 14, 2025 8:00 AM - 2:00 PM
Where: Campus-wide
Description: Troy Compost has been organizing a number of big composting initiatives in Troy, such as the Farmer's Market foodscraps collection, a project that diverts food waste from landfills to get composted at local farms instead. Volunteering with us is a 2-hour, low-intensity, educational gig that does good work for a community organization, local farms, and the Troy waste stream. You don't have to be an expert on compost to help out. Contact Guy Schaffer at schafe@rpi.edu for more information.

To schedule an appointment, call 1-800-642-7131, Monday through Friday, 8:00 am to midnight, or online at https://nb.fidelity.com/public/nbpreloginnav/rpi/microsite/#/tem/meet-with-us
Contact: Human Resources 518-276-6302

item.title: Division of Human Resources Professional Development Workshop: "Leading from Anywhere”
item.description:
Tuesday, June 17, 2025 9:00 AM - 11:00 AM
Where: Rensselaer Union (RU), Conference Room 3202
Cost: Free-Registration is Required
Description: At Rensselaer, we maintain that “leadership” involves a learnable set of actions and behaviors that is available to everyone. In this workshop, participants will explore the tenants that comprise everyday leadership and discuss the behaviors that define leadership not as positional or based on title, but rather on values and actions.
Contact: Melissa Duquette 5182763931

item.title: TEM Sample Preparation Short Course
item.description:
Tuesday, June 17, 2025 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM
Where: J - ROWL 1C13
Cost: Free
Description: Participants will have the option to practice Transmission Electron Microscopy (TEM) sample preparation and TEM imaging with a sample from their own project. Submitting samples ahead of time is preferred to accommodate as many samples as possible. Lunch will be included, registration is limited to 25 participants
Contact: Katharine Dovidenko

item.title: MBA for Professionals Information Session with Rensselaer at Work
item.description:
Tuesday, June 17, 2025 7:00 PM - 7:30 PM
Where: Online
Description: Learn to lead from every aspect of an organization with a real-world MBA experience. Prepare to lead the most dynamic and innovative organizations. Engage, involve, motivate, and lead others to reach their fullest potential. \nJoin Rensselaer Dean Aric Krause, Ph. D.,  as he reviews this innovative project-based, online MBA for professionals program. Please register to receive login details to join this virtual event.
Contact: Alice A. Denny (860) 548-2403

item.title: Graduate Summer Lunch & Learn-Writing Research and Teaching Statements for Academic Careers- Registration Required
item.description:
Wednesday, June 18, 2025 12:00 PM - 2:30 PM
Where: CBIS Bruggeman Room
Description: Writing Research and Teaching Statements for Academic Careers-\nResearch and teaching statements are core components of the academic job application. In this lunch and learn, we will break down their key elements and offer strategies for translating your work and vision into compelling narratives. We’ll discuss how to tailor your statements to different institutions and articulate impact. Ideal for graduate students and postdocs preparing for the academic job market.Hybrid event.
Contact: Noelle Sanchez 518-276-8433

item.title: School of Science Arch Field Trip: Yale Peabody Museum of Natural History
item.description:
Thursday, June 19, 2025 6:00 AM - 7:30 PM
Where: New Haven, CT Connecticut
Description: ALL MAJORS WELCOME! Students will have the opportunity to engage with exhibits showcasing dinosaur fossils, ancient artifacts, minerals, and cultural treasures from around the world. Free breakfast and lunch will be provided. Meet at RPI Union horseshoe entrance at 6:00 AM, bus departure at 6:30 AM. Bus will return to RPI by 7:30 PM. Sign-up ends 4 PM on June 18.
Contact: Kaylyn Getwright 5182766305

item.title: Science (Fiction) in the Capital
item.description:
Thursday, June 19, 2025 7:30 AM - 9:00 AM
Where: Roger Bacon Hall Friars Rd Latham NY 12110
Description: Capitalists and tech broligarchs want to own the future. How does science fiction offer visions of a more just world, one built by humans' innate faculty for creativity and creation? Join Dr. Mitch R. Murray (Communication and Media) for a public lecture on sci fi at Siena College (226 Roger Bacon Hall at 7:30 PM).
Contact: Mitch Murray

Where: Mueller Center

item.description:
Saturday, June 21, 2025 7:30 AM - 7:30 PM
Where: Utica, NY New York
Description: ALL MAJORS WELCOME! Students will explore the Utica Zoo, which exhibits over 140 individual animals representing 64 species. Free breakfast and lunch will be provided. Meet at RPI Union horseshoe entrance at 7:30 AM, bus departure at 8:00 AM. Bus will return to RPI by 7:30 PM. Sign-up ends 4 PM on June 20.
Contact: Kaylyn Getwright 5182766305

item.title: School of Science Arch Field Trip: Museum of the Earth
item.description:
Tuesday, June 24, 2025 6:00 AM - 5:00 PM
Where: Ithaca, NY New York
Description: ALL MAJORS WELCOME! Students can explore 8,000-square-feet of exhibitions that takes visitors on a journey through 4.5 billion years of history. Exhibits include the Hype Park Mastodon, the 44-foot long Right Whale #2030 skeleton and the Coral Reef Aquaria. A one-hour program on Evolution and the Fossil Record is also included. Free breakfast and lunch will be provided. Meet at RPI Union horseshoe entrance at 6AM, bus departure at 6:30AM. Return to RPI by 5PM. Sign-up ends 4PM June 23.
Contact: Kaylyn Getwright 5182766305

item.description:
Tuesday, June 24, 2025 7:00 PM - 7:30 PM
Where: Online
Description: Join Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph.D., on a 30-minute information session highlighting Rensselaer's online, project-based graduate certificate programs in Leading Change and Innovation, and Managing Technical Organizations. Expect to learn how individuals can manage and lead effective cross-functional teams, and implement changes designed to optimize the realization of tactics and strategies. Please complete the form if you plan to join.
